text: On 22 September 2018, a military parade was attacked in the southwestern Iranian city of Ahvaz. It became the deadliest terrorist attack in Iran since 2010. Both the Arab Struggle Movement for the Liberation of Ahwaz and the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant claimed responsibility for the attack. Iran claims that United States, Saudi Arabia and Mossad are responsible for the mass shooting. On 22 September 2018, at 09:00 local time, four gunmen wearing military uniforms as Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps and Basiji (volunteers) began shooting at the parade from a nearby park. 29 people died and 70 were injured. The attack lasted about ten minutes. ==References== Category:2018 disasters in Asia Category:2018 mass shootings Category:2010s mass shootings in Asia Category:2010s in Iran Category:Islamic State Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in Asia Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in the 2010s Category:Mass murder in Asia Category:Mass murder in 2018 Category:September 2018 events Category:Terrorist incidents in Asia in the 2010s
title: Ahvaz military parade attack
